title: Council Decision of 28 June 2004 appointing the full members and alternate members of the Administrative Board of the European Foundation for the Improvement of Living and Working Conditions for the Czech Republic, Estonia, Cyprus, Latvia, Lithuania, Hungary, Malta, Poland, Slovenia and Slovakia
header:
18.1.2005 EN Official Journal of the European Union C 12/1
COUNCIL DECISION
of 28 June 2004
appointing the full members and alternate members of the Administrative Board of the European Foundation for the Improvement of Living and Working Conditions for the Czech Republic, Estonia, Cyprus, Latvia, Lithuania, Hungary, Malta, Poland, Slovenia and Slovakia
(2005/C 12/01)
THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN UNION
recitals:
,
Having regard to the Treaty establishing the European Community,
Having regard to the Act of Accession of the Czech Republic, the Republic of Estonia, the Republic of Cyprus, the Republic of Latvia, the Republic of Lithuania, the Republic of Hungary, the Republic of Malta, the Republic of Poland, the Republic of Slovenia and the Slovak Republic to the European Union (1), and in particular Article 20 thereof,
Having regard to Council Regulation (EEC) No 1365/75 of 26 May 1975 on the creation of a European Foundation for the Improvement of Living and Working Conditions (2), as last amended by Regulation (EEC) No 1947/93 (3), and in particular Article 6 thereof,
Having regard to the lists of nominees submitted to the Council by the Governments of the Czech Republic, Estonia, Cyprus, Latvia, Lithuania, Hungary, Malta, Poland, Slovenia and Slovakia for government representatives and those forwarded by the Commission for representatives of workers' and employers' organisations,
Whereas:
(1) By its Decision of 8 November 2001 (4) the Council appointed the full members and alternate members of the Administrative Board of the European Foundation for the Improvement of Living and Working Conditions for the period from 19 October 2001 to 18 October 2004.
(2) The full members and alternates representing the Governments of the new Member States and workers' and employers' organisations there must be appointed for the period ending on 18 October 2004,
main_body:
The following are hereby appointed full members and alternate members of the Administrative Board of the European Foundation for the Improvement of Living and Working Conditions for the period remaining until 18 October 2004:
I.   GOVERNMENT REPRESENTATIVES
Country Full member Alternate member
Czech Republic Mr Vlastimil VÁŇA Mr Josef JIRKAL
Estonia Mr Tiit KAADU Mr Ivar RAIK
Cyprus Ms Lenia SAMUEL Mr Charalambos KOLOKOTRONIS
Latvia Ms Ineta TĀRE Ms Ineta VJAKSE
Lithuania Ms Rita KAZLAUSKIENE Ms Milda PETROKAITE
Hungary Ms Mária LADÓ Ms Edit VIRÁG
Malta Mr John CAMILLERI Ms Anna BORG
Poland Ms Agnieszka CHLON-DOMIŃCZAK Mr Jerzy CIECHAŃSKI
Slovenia Ms Vladka KOMEL Ms Metka Štoka DEBEVEC
Slovakia Ms Elena MICHALDOVÁ Ms Elena BARTUNKOVÁ

Cyprus Mr Demetris KITTENIS Mr Petros THEOPHANOUS
Latvia Ms Iveta OZOLA Ms Lolita BURBO
Lithuania Ms Janina MATUIZIENE Mr Vaidotas PETRONIS
Hungary Ms Erzsébet HANTI Mr László GYIMESI
Malta Mr Michael PARNIS Mr Charles MAGRO
Poland Mr Bogdan OLSZEWSKI Ms Agata BARANOWSKA-GRYCUK
Slovenia Mr Pavle VRHOVEC Mr Jure SNOJ
Slovakia Ms Eva MEŠŤANOVÁ Ms Margita ANČICOVÁ
III.   REPRESENTANTIVES OF EMPLOYERS' ORGANISATIONS
Country Full member Alternate member
Czech Republic Ms Vladimira DRBALOVÁ Mr Josef FORNŮSEK
Estonia Ms Eve PÄÄRENDSON Mr Tarmo KRIIS
Cyprus Mr Michael ANTONIOU Ms Lena PANAYIOTOU
Latvia Ms Elina EGLE Mr Edgars KORČAGINS
Lithuania Ms Laura SIRVYDIENE Mr Dmitrj SLEPNIOV
Hungary Mr Antal CSUPORT Mr Attila SZABADKAI
Malta Mr John SCICLUNA Ms Roselyn BORG
Poland Mr Michał BONI Mr Andrzej JANKOWSKI
Slovenia Mr Marjan RAVNIK Ms Nina GLOBOČNIK
Slovakia
attachments:
Done at Luxembourg, 28 June 2004
For the Council
The President
M. CULLEN
(1)  OL L 236, 23.9.2003.
(2)  OJ L 139, 30.5.1975, p. 1.
(3)  OJ L 181, 23.7.1993, p. 13.
(4)  OJ C 327, 22.11.2001, p. 1.
